name: paradigmatically
content:
paradigmatically adverb
(EXAMPLE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal in a way that acts as a model, or a clear and typical example of something: Philosophy is, paradigmatically, a kind of dialogue. Such a stereotype is seen as defending the weak, paradigmatically children and women, in emergency situations. Related word
paradigm
More examplesFewer examplesShame comes paradigmatically from being exposed, from being mocked, and from being rejected by the group.

paradigmatically adverb
(LANGUAGE )
language
  specialized in a way that relates to how different words or language items can be chosen to play a particular part in a language structure: In English and French, one might argue that adjectives are paradigmatically equivalent in that they modify nouns in both languages. Related word
paradigmatic
More examplesFewer examplesThis process is exemplified by the following two paradigmatically related forms. This combination could be corrected paradigmatically by replacing the hyponym "brother" with the hypernym "relative".
